intro: Callisia amplexicaulis, commonly known as the trailing hurricane plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Commelinaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and sometimes clasping, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in various light conditions.
